WorkItem.Description: When clicking on an unselected item and moving the mouse cursor while the LMB is still down, the TreeViewEx will start a drag'n'drop operation (assuming the item is draggable). The expected behavior (observed in Windows Explorer for instance) is that an element should start a drag'n'drop operation only if it is already selected when the LMB is pressed.
WorkItem.Summary: The control can start dragging an item when it should draw a selection rectangle

Comments.Message: If I click in windows explorer on a unselected file, it selects an then starts the dragndrop operation. I think the behaviour is correct?

Yes actually the behavior is a bit more complicated:
 - if the file is not selected:
    - if the user clicks on a non-empty area of the item (file name, icon, date... ie anywhere there is a control under), it selects and start a D&D operation. (1)
    - if the user clicks on a empty area (the empty space to the right of the file name for instance), then it draws a selection rectangle (2)
 - if the file is selected, the background is not transparent anymore, so I guess the hit detection passes and it always start a D&D operation. (3)

However, in the sample, I think the case (2) does not work. But it is probably just a matter of setting a transparent background somewhere in the template.
